body:
### Problem

When repeatedly executing a normal mode command with `vgo` as the motion, it alternates between being an inclusive and exclusive motion. This affects both built-in commands and plugins.

Vim also exhibits this, see vim/vim#15580.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Enter some text into a buffer.
2. Place the cursor somewhere before the end of the buffer.
3. Type `dvgo` in normal mode.
4. Observe that all the text in the buffer before and including the cursor gets deleted.
5. Type `dvgo` again, or type `.`.
6. Observe that nothing gets deleted.
7. Type `dvgo` again, or type `.`.
8. Observe that the character under the cursor gets deleted.
9. Repeat steps 5-8 as long as you want.

Notably, moving the cursor (such as via `lh`) before step 5 prevents the issue; the next use of `dvgo` includes the cursor.

### Expected behavior

`dvgo` should always delete all the text in the buffer before and including the cursor.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

0.10.1 and 0.11.0-dev-3a61f05dd

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

Yes, vim 9.1.0697

### Operating system/version

Arch Linux x86_64 up-to-date as of 2024-08-23

### Terminal name/version

Alacritty 0.13.2 (bb8ea18e)

### $TERM environment variable

alacritty

### Installation

Arch Linux Repository
title: `vgo` motion is only sometimes inclusive
